items.title: Most expensive trains ever and there…
items.review_text: Most expensive trains ever and there always are problems. While I'm writing, by the way, I'm stuck in a station, doors closed, 1h and a half of delay in a 30 minutes ride, increasing. No possibilities to leave, no information regarding when we will restart (more like a kidnap than a poor service). For the love of god, stay away from this service whenever possible

items.title: You’re a joke of a rail line
items.review_text: You’re a joke of a rail line! How can MK have a faster train than Aylesbury in to London! Always packed out, trains are 30 years old and you charge an arm and a leg to get to London! You’re a mess and sort it out absolutely sick of it! Grow up and make a fast train from Aylesbury!!!! And stop messing around

items.title: The service generally seems ok and…
items.review_text: The service generally seems ok and there always seems to be lots of staff around with the Chiltern logo clothing to ask questions too however the majority seem clueless about the move to ticketless booking or how their systems work - there was a group of 2 ppl talking from Chiltern who said they didn’t even know Chiltern had an app or anything about smart cards when I asked for assistance.  Also when I called the helpline I was called back only to be then transferred to another team who wasn’t current open so no help there also. They seem to have the ppl but clearly training is missing.

items.title: Used the Oxford parkway part and ride…
items.review_text: Used the Oxford parkway part and ride today and caught the train into Oxford. Using the ticket machine it came up with an any day single price much higher the Chiltern Railway website. I challenged this with a member of staff - Sean Dawson. He couldn’t have been more helpful and found tickets for our group that represented the best value and I found his manner attitude and genuine desire to assist a refreshing change, and he is a credit to Chiltern railways.

items.title: I am pretty disgusted that Chiltern is…
items.review_text: I am pretty disgusted that Chiltern is refusing to compensate for strike action taken by ASLEF. Having booked a day return to Stratford upon Avon that I was subsequently unable to use owing to the strike, the company is refusing to reimburse the ticket on grounds it was bought through a third party website. This is fraud on a grand scale but typical of the state of UK railways now which wriggle out of paying any compensation.

items.title: As an independent company for 25 years
items.review_text:
As an independent company for 25 years, led by Adrian Shooter, and backed by private capital from 3i, this was the No.1 rail line in mainland Britain.
 
Since, the badly-named, Arriva took over it has slumped markedly. Shabby, overcrowded, dirty carriages and lack of investment all evident in 3 trips in April 2024. All the cash has gone into the eco-disaster HS2. The UK government stand idly by….mediocrity is their mantra it seems.

Time for an overhaul. We know how really good Chiltern Rail can be if run properly.

items.title: Guy Watts of Chiltern Railways is…
items.review_text: Guy Watts of Chiltern Railways is nothing but a bully intimidating teenager girls due to his position. My teenage daughter who suffers with anxiety returned home today after dealing with this man over a genuine error when purchasing a ticket, during his intimidation towards her she had picked her finger nails until they bled. This person should not be in this position dealing with the public. Pointless making a complaint to Chiltern Railways as I have been informed they never deal with this kind of complaint and all stick together. Beware of this individual.

items.title: Wembley shambles for Oxford bound trains!!
items.review_text: Absolutely useless, no extra trains to Oxford. Constant misinformation and announcements basically saying you're gonna miss the next train and the wait is around 2 hours. Never again. If CR add a comment, believe me it's not genuine as their CS have no interest in listening to anybody.

items.title: Guy Watts of Chiltern Railways - what a star.
items.review_text:
I went to the recent England game v Brazil at Wembley (23rd March) travelling from Denham to Wembley Stadium with a friend in a wheel chair. 

On arrival at Wembley we enquired about queueing after the game with a wheelchair and use of the lift at the station. 

We were fortunate to ask Guy Watts, and employee of Chiltern Railways (the station controller / manager) who couldn't have been more helpful. What a star. He advised of train timings, to look out for him, where to queue etc.

When we arrived after the game he met us, took us down in the lift, told us where to stand for the wheelchair access, collected a ramp for the wheelchair, phoned ahead to the train to advise that we would be using a ramp and then helped us get our friend on to the train. An absolute star. Guy Watts. Thank you

items.title: Ticket office
items.review_text: It's great that all the helpful and smiling staff are still employed at the ticket office (High Wycombe). Many people, myself included appreciate their stay of execution and long  may it remain.

items.title: Another Chiltern line shambles
items.review_text:
Booked ticket day before travel. Checked Chiltern website showing disruption but hourly trains.  
Arrived at Station to travel to find trains cancelled at 10.09pm night before without warning for bus replacement service to Amersham leaving 20 minutes after my train should have and arriving at Amersham 20minutes after my train should have arrived in Marylebone and I paid £42.50 for the privilege as well as the taxi fare to catch a non existent train
This company is becoming a shambles with its last minute changes and cancellations and lack of putting enough carriages on trains to cope with the volume of passengers

items.title: A Disgraceful decline in the train…
items.review_text: A Disgraceful decline in the train services in UK overall but this company seems to be the worst. Over crowded, late and canceled trains has become the norm and no one seems to care anymore. It’s like a third world country. A depressing reality when compared to the services in the majority of the European countries where trains are far more civilised, modern, fast and far CHEAPER.

items.title: Unfit for service
items.review_text: When I arrived at Solihull station I found that the 14:54pm train to London Marylebone was cancelled, so I sat on the platform for an hour waiting for the next train. The 15:54pm train got as far as Warwick Parkway, when we were told there was a problem, and it had to crawl to Leamington Spa, I could have walked quicker. We were then told the windscreen wipers were broken, so we were off loaded (by the way it was not even raining). I then had to wait for the third train of the day which was the 16:49pm which was overcrowded, and I had to stand all the way to London, I am 63. I arrived 2.45 hours later at 18:26pm instead of 16:46pm. I put a complaint to Chilternrailways, and requested a refund. Chilternrailways have given me a derisory £12 refund, and do not seem particularly bothered by what happened!

items.title: A lady drinking on the train started getting aggressive
items.review_text: There was a drunk lady who was drinking a whole bottle of champagne and was swearing so I asked her to lower her voice but she carried on and started threatening me and telling me to fight outside and to leave the train and she was with 2 other boys who where taking the mickey

items.title: I’m a disabled person with MS and I’m…
items.review_text:
I’m a disabled person with MS and I’m flabbergasted at the continual lack of rolling stock on services between Birmingham Moor Street and London Marylebone. All carriages are habitually overcrowded with many passengers left standing. Thankfully a lovely young lady gave up her seat, because she saw my walking stick but I’d otherwise be lucky to get a seat on any given Sunday!

Oh and Chiltern, lovely chicken advert BTW! Pack them in as hard as you can, why don’t you?

items.title: Their website is not working AGAIN
items.review_text: Their website is not working AGAIN!  Unable to book tickets, access my account with them, no up to date information about strike days timetable.....  Need I go on?  Already commented on ridiculously short trains in previous review, so I have little expectation that they will read this one either.  How lovely it would be to have a proper, grown-up, efficient rail service.

items.title: Saturday 25th November
items.review_text:
Saturday 25th November. Warwick Parkway to Marylebone 09.42. Aimed for rear carriage expecting the "quiet" carriage as did many others. No seats and amazingly connecting door to next carriage forward was locked - no escape.
Eventually about 50 people standing for most of the journey but apparently all carriages were the same!
18.02, Marylebone to W Parkway , experience repeated - four coaches not six. Felt sorry for the staff having to constantly apologise.
We have travelled Chiltern for years - will avoid in future as progressively getting worse, enough is enough.
Ironically an email asking for "feedback on your journey" couldn't be sent - clever 😕

items.title: A once good company in terminal decline
items.review_text: It seems Chiltern Railways use the threat of strikes to cancel all their trains on the Aylesbury-Marylebone line. Even when the strike is cancelled they reinstate the trains but don’t have them stopping at most of the stations. It used to be a very well run company but is now pretty terrible with many cancellations and much overcrowding.

items.title: Outrageous overcrowding!!!
items.review_text:
Caught the 09:17 train from Banbury to London Marylebone this morning, and to say the train was overcrowded is a drastic understatement. We stood the entire way - literally packed in like sardines. There was absolutely no air circulating, leading to numerous standing passengers feeling faint (including my daughter) and needing to try and sit on the floor (nigh impossible due to lack of space) to stop from falling over. 
Considering it was the first train leaving after the morning rush hour (so cheaper tickets) and being half term holidays, only providing 4 carriages was unbelievably bad planning on Chiltern Railways part. 
Do better!

items.title: Once again a "technical issue"…
items.review_text: Once again a "technical issue" this time the information displays have gone belly up. Chiltern are consistently overcrowded and regularly late or cancelled. But don't expect an explanation or even notification. Short trains at rush hour and long trains during the day. Ask a question of the many staff standing around and expect a facetious response. I've just paid over 5 grand for a season ticket (no other option unfortunately) for a sub-par, unreliable service provided by, frankly, uninterested people. And yet they are striking for pay. Hmmm. Summary... Lucky for Chiltern, there is no competition.

items.title: I left my bag on the train today.…
items.review_text:
I left my bag on the train today.I spoke to the clerk at the station. 
I couldn't thank her enough for helping me to get my bag back.
While waiting for news of my bag, she made me a coffee also gave me a bottle of water and some biscuits. 
Also contacted me later on to tell me where my bag has been left for me to pick up tomorrow.

items.title: I have lived on this Line for decades
items.review_text:
I have lived on this Line for decades. I recall a time when Chiltern were #1. I use the service to London less frequently, indeed, since covid times, hardly at all. (My partner commutes daily). I was appalled on a recent journey at the state of the seats, cleanliness and overall  carriage state. Nothing has changed, a steady decline in comfort and hygiene was evident. This rolling stock is an embarrassment. I am sure that ticket prices will rise in Jan, where..does the money go?
A bad year for reliability, a poor year for Arriva. Shameful.

items.title: Applied for a refund over 3 weeks ago…
items.review_text: Applied for a refund over 3 weeks ago due to the industrial action. What a rubbish system had to print off and pay for postage to Arbroath in Scotland  plus fill in a form. Web site says refund should be made within 10 working days nothing heard so phoned after 2 weeks was told would be processed by last Friday still heard nothing. Compare to LNER delay repay took one click on line fare refunded within 2 days.

items.title: Deteriorating service
items.review_text: Chiltern Railways used to be a reliable and comfortable carrier from London out to the Chilterns. In recent times it seems the trains on the Aylesbury via Amersham line barely exist, and when they do they suffer from overcrowding due to a lack of carriage provision. On top of that, the regular two day strikes are used as an excuse to cancel the trains for the whole week. I’m glad to no longer be a season ticket holder.

items.title: The Service Gets Worse by the Week
items.review_text: Once one of this countries best rail companies I regret to say they are now one of the worst.It doesn't help having Avanti as their main competitor on the London-Birmingham route.Hardly putting pressure on Chiltern!They really don't care about customer comfort especially at weekends.Putting 4 coaches on a main line service is laughable if it wasn't so uncomfortable.No word of an apology for cattle truck like conditions.I am sorry Chiltern things need to improve from the Top down!!

items.title: Absolutely filthy even post Covid pandemic- shocking!
items.review_text:
London to Leamington Spa. Absolutely filthy train. Toilets were missing paper towels, hand dryer wasn't working. Seats are dirty, tables were filthy with sweet wrappers, wet wipes amongst other rubbish all squeezed behind the plug socket.  Was too afraid to pull out the table in case of what would jump out. 
With all the hygiene levels increased due to the Covid pandemic this train should no longer be on the tracks!

items.title: Chiltern can't tell an email from a password.
items.review_text:
As a result of previous complaint about not being able to correct my EMAIL ADDRESS on my CR Account, within a very short time I had a rather patronizing  response with a 'Press Here' link.
Pity, it was to change my PASSWORD!   
Presumably, from the same team who are now running what used to be the best passenger railway operation on the Network.  But, least THEY are reading our comments.

items.title: Not good !
items.review_text: Only now discovered a Trustpilot forum for this rail company so this is belated.   Journey from L. Spa to London on Sat 27 Nov in on a 5 carriage train was terrible with passengers crammed like sardines.   Why only 5 carriages ?. The irony of signage on the carriage windows advising 2 metre distance.  No wonder Chiltern don't respond to complaints......they'd be doing nothing else.

items.title: THEY MAKE PASSENGERS TO OXFORD RUN FOR…
items.review_text:
THEY MAKE PASSENGERS TO OXFORD RUN FOR THE TRAIN,  FURTHEST PLATFORM BUT DONT ANOUNCE UNTIL 4 MINS , *THOSE WITH POOR MOBIITY HAVE TO STAND* THE FIT ONES CAN SIT DOWN! CHITERN RAILWAYS THINk ITS A LAUGH TO CAUSE DiSABLED PASSENGERS PAIN And ..The trains from Parkway LEAVE EARLY  * You have been warned* 
Disgraceful, anti-social practices  - nasty
Over crowded 2 carriage train many standing from Bicester village - anti-passenger, anti-social

items.title: Enough of the excessive strikes
items.review_text: Enough of the excessive strikes! Embrace technology, replace staff with robots/computers. Trains originate from the UK but electric trains have been running in the rest of Europe for half a century while the UK still runs more expensive and polluting diesel? Who's running this country?

items.title: I’ve just had a journey that justifies…
items.review_text: I’ve just had a journey that justifies the ridiculous chicken advert Chiltern Railways uses! No aircon, people standing all the way from Marylebone to Bicester, stopped for 10 minutes and no announcement, apology, explanation. I usually rate Chiltern and no doubt people largely go on here when they’ve had a bad experience. This was my worst in the 20 years I’ve been using the railway. The train was the 16.46 from Marylebone to Birmingham Snow Hill, today 18th May. Give your driver / guard some training on customer service please

items.title: I just want to know who are those…
items.review_text: I just want to know who are those people who put 5 stars in their reviews. Surely they use CR trains once or twice a year. I have been using CR for almost 10 years several times a week and it has been awful experience - especially recently - crowded trains with broken air cons, stuffy, constant signalling problems and delays, old carriages and super expensive tickets. The only reason why I am still using CR is because I do not have a choice. The CR owners and leadership team should be ashamed of how they treat their passengers and staff!

items.title: Shocking
items.review_text: Shocking. I have travelled every day this week and no seats from Haddenham - standing room only. Rarely a seat home as well. Customer Services the most ignorant pedants. They have a monopoly and are exploiting us. If only there were competition on the railways, incompetent profiteers like Chiltern would get their dues and go bust.

items.title: Dreadful journey from Banbury to Marylebone
items.review_text: Standing on the platform at Banbury waiting for the 10:40 and I heard that there was JUST 4 carriages. The train was jammed and I along several other passengers had to stand all the way to Marylebone. Talking to a lady standing beside me she said that the last 10 journeys had all been the same. It was a dreadful journey, hot, uncomfortable and the more people that used the toilet the more it stank each time the toilet door was opened. We could not escape the smell as there was no where else to stand. Chiltern Railways management should be ashamed of themselves.

items.title: Nostalgic Chiltern Rail
items.review_text:
Are we back in the nostalgic 1940s?
Leaking station roof, train time departure boards written in chalk, clueless staff… Let’s get onto the carriage of a Diesel engine train puffing smoke through the station - cough, cough. This toilet is out of order, the doors of the next one open although locked just as I sit down. Delays, delays, delays not of course due to Chiltern Rail  - promises that one day a train will have enough carriages to comfortably accommodate the number of passengers…
Thank goodness the train ticket prices are low and profits being reinvested in the business - ha ha ha 😆

All congratulations to Deutsche Bahn!

items.title: Unreliable and expensive…
items.review_text: 15th September once again trains cancelled from London Marylebone to Aylesbury. No driver 😩. Absolutely useless over priced service. Once upon a time they were reliable, now it seems they are not fit for purpose. Employee some more drivers...... There are plenty of people willing to do the job.

items.title: What was supposed to be a family day…
items.review_text:
What was supposed to be a family day out to London was get again ruined by Chiltern Railways.  I appreciate it’s busy due to half term but to be crammed into a carriage to the point your preying the doors don’t open as you’ll fall out is not the experience I’d want to repeat…but highly likely with chiltern railways.
No toilets available on the train so more discomfort for passengers however unlikely you’ll be able to squeeze through the crowds. I’d opt for the Trainline into Euston if you’d prefer a more comfortable journey.  Would complain but they never respond.

items.title: Consistently Overcrowded
items.review_text: The service from Banbury is terrible.  The last four trains I’ve taken have been standing room only, all squished like sardines, for the entire hour-long trip to London.  The trains are not clean, the Wifi never works.  The timetable is completely unreliable due to either technical failures or industrial action.  Now the station toilets are out of order too.  I just submitted a claim because my train yesterday was 21 minutes late (as well as having no seats) and it’s been automatically rejected because “no record of a delay was found”.  Well I can tell you, there was a 21 minute delay and I know very well, because I was late to a meeting and watching the clock the whole way!!

items.title: Awful
items.review_text:
One of the worst companies around 
Trains are always late the staff are rude and aggressive and have no understanding especially in Banbury 
Always striking and so many rail replacements buses 
Tickets are so expensive for and awful experience if I can just drive don’t bother with the train very bad company

items.title: the staff of chiltern railways should…
items.review_text:
the staff of chiltern railways have a poor attitude. lettiing down the public.  self interest and dont care 
 Aylesbury to london trains this afternoon cancelled as staff sick. 2 hour wait. rest of staff very rude and disinterested.

items.title: Avoid
items.review_text: Very disappointed with how many people on this line were not wearing masks in the midst of a lockdown, especially since the train was busier than usual due to difficulties with other routes/lines. No staff anywhere to be found to enforce mask wearing. In addition, very poor circulation on train. Would avoid this line when possible.

items.title: I have travelled on Chiltern Railways…
items.review_text: I have travelled on Chiltern Railways for many years between Haddenham and London Marylebone. While sympathetic through Covid times to the challenge of running a rail service, their performance since lockdown was eased has been appalling. Short trains, on every service I have taken, with 20 people standing by the doors and in the aisles. Its like a cattle truck. If there was an alternative rail service I would be taking it.

items.title: This used to be ok
items.review_text:
This used to be ok, but the service has dived in the last few years. Unreliable times, very crowded short services, poor maintenance at stations and over the strike period they’ve basically given up on running any kind of service.

What was good the fools at Arriva have managed to ruin in short order.

items.title: The worst railway service I’ve used in…
items.review_text: The worst railway service I’ve used in the UK. Very frequent delays and cancellations. Unheated carriages, making the journey unbearable in winter months. Putting only two carriages from Oxford to Marylbone during rush hour, leaving no space for everyone to sit- let alone wheelchair users or cyclists. Insanely expensive for the service they’re offering.

items.title: Rubbish like virtually everything else "Chiltern Railways"
items.review_text:
I received an email directly from Chiltern Railways inviting me to enter a competition.  I quote "To celebrate the easing of restrictions National Rail is giving 12 lucky people the chance to WIN a year of free rail travel* and a unique golden ticket designed by artist Claire Rollet.

Sounds good right? Simply click the button below to enter. Make sure to enter before 23.59 on 7 October 😉 to win"

Of course, like virtually everything else "Chiltern Railways" the link (aforementioned button) does not work.  It merely activates a URL which just presents a blank page.
If you get an email inviting you to enter the competition .... don't waste your time.

items.title: Rude customer service staff
items.review_text: Watch out the Chilterns train doors close 1minute before the time on days when they want to make extra money from customers. I complained and the  customer service guy at the ticket office  just smirked and said the next train will cost you £36. He didn't even advise me that why some days doors close 30seconds and some days on the exact time or there has been days 1minute after. This incident happened at 08/03/23 at 20:19.  I am very appalled with this train service I used to use this service regularly from Birmingham to London. Now I will have to use Avanti or Westmidland railways.

items.title: USE ANOTHER TRAIN COMPANY IF POSSIBLE!!
items.review_text:
Yet again more problems with this company! 3 train journeys with them this year and had issues every single time!! Tried booking tickets from Stourbridge to London this week but it kept saying there was a problem with payment. Tried various debit cards and eventually payment went through. It turns out they had actually charged me twice - 2 x £58. There is always some problem with this company!! Surely there should be a regulator monitoring companies like this. Have you read their reviews? What an embarrassment. If possible stay clear of them otherwise you will end up with problems like so many other people.
In addition, Wi-Fi rarely works on their trains.

items.title: First time taking chiltern railway from…
items.review_text:
First time taking chiltern railway from London to Oxford. 
Last minute cheap ticket was convenient but the trains definitely need a good update and hygiene wise enormous improvements to be made ! 
What are we paying our taxes for ? !!

items.title: Is it 1973 or 2023? Shockingly bad
items.review_text: The worst railway company in the UK bar none it's not 2023 it's 1973 all over again!  The trains are ancient, stinking, dirty mess, grubby seats and carpets, toilets a disgrace, regularly the HVAC has packed up so you get boiled alive or frozen solid but never comfortable. Even had one with no lighting on an evening train home, sitting for an hour in total darkness. There is never enough rolling stock, shortened down 2 or 3 car trains that used to be 4 or 6 car ones, dangerous levels of overcrowding is frequently an issue. The line is bumpy (granted that is network rail), particularly bad south bound past Bicester, the price is absolutely extortionate (£100 for a travcard from Banbury!), the staff unbelievably surly and rude. Sooner the government step in and take on the franchise from the abysmal pathetic excuse for a company arriva trains the better. If I could give 0 stars I would! Truly truly terrible.

items.title: Surprised by this wonderful trip
items.review_text: After reading these afwul reviews I was reluctant to book a ticket at Chiltern railways, but it was so much cheaper that I took the risk. An adult and a child ticket for 8 pounds from London to Oxford. I was surprised about everything. The train was on time, we had very spacious seats with a table, no overcrowding. It was clean and it went as planned. Thank you Chiltern Railways!

items.title: Another day
items.review_text: Another day, another requirement to apply for a refund. Please government take this operator out of service and do what you did to the East Coast and operate in house. 30yr old trains. Complete joke. Monopoly operation taking advantage of passengers. Makes me want to move home. The day CR are out of service the better.

items.title: Train ride from Bicester Village to London
items.review_text: On 25 Nov I was taking the train at 5:04pm from Bicester Village to London Marylebone. The train had a faulty signal and everybody was asked to leave the train immediately. The staff then asked everybody to rush to the opposite platform immediately and advised that the next train at 5:30pm will arrive in that platform. Many were shoppers from Bicester Village so it was chaotic. The passengers finally settled on the opposite platform, but then the train at 5:30pm arrived at the original platform again, and people had to run towards the original platform to catch that train. The staff had no clue before giving instructions and the experience was incredibly unpleasant.

items.title: Awful experience
items.review_text: Awful experience. I have never found a sit in this railways (train from London Marylebone to Birmingham). I have to pay almost £40 everytime to stand for an hour and a half.There is always more than 10 people standing in each coach. Just add some coaches to offer a decent service. If I had a choice I would never travel using this railways again.

items.title: Dreadful trains
items.review_text:
Chiltern railways seem to hold their customers in utter contempt. They are currently providing the only service Oxford-London (due to a broken bridge on the GWR line) and yet despite this and knowing they’ll have an influx of passengers they consistently run short, old and dirty trains. The journey is 1hr 20 and there are no plugs or tables available, not even folding ones on the back of the seats. The trains are regularly crammed, everyone is uncomfortable. The seats are tiny and the legroom negligible (and I’m quite short!). These trains would be fine for short journeys but it’s insane that they are used for journeys of over an hour. 

Given that the company do own and run better/newer trains, I cannot understand why they want their passengers to be miserable. 

Chiltern rail is just the most awful way to travel. Please do better, it’s not acceptable.

items.title: Over hour journey and standing room…
items.review_text: Over hour journey and standing room only. Rubbish for a 30 quid ticket. Put an extra carriage or two on you tight ar5es. Should have took the car like I usually do.

items.title: Third world travel
items.review_text:
Awful , overcrowded trains , expensive, uncomfortable,  no electricity points etc etc . 
Just keep packing the commuters in to too small trains . Buy some carriages and quit with the share holders bonuses.  The descent of this once quite good service is appalling and they don't care a lot.

items.title: Absolutely unreliable service
items.review_text: Absolutely unreliable service. Train is running late yet again and overcrowded. Me along with 40 other passengers in this compartment have to make the journey back to Aylesbury Vale Parkway standing. Consistently let down by this train operator, and yet one of the most expensive.

items.title: Wifi connection appalling
items.review_text: Made the fatal mistake of booking a chiltern railway journey. Cannot use wifi on kindle as it doesnt connect. Keeps asking the same question again and again or doesnt move on to the next page. Falsely says we dont have to register and can use a temp connection. Awful!

items.title: Sad to see how poor this service has become…
items.review_text: Genuinely saddened by how poor this service has become. Pre Covid this was a great service. Now the timetable is much reduced, the trains are much shorter and overcrowded (to the point that you often can’t get on) and I can’t remember the last time a train I caught with them was on time.  They offer refunds for delays and cancellations but you will not actually get one because their system is so overloaded with applications. If I have a meeting first thing I will drive to get the Elizabeth Line. A real shame.

items.title: This is a disgrace..
items.review_text: This is a disgrace... They couldn't care less about the passengers. The prices do not reflect the quality at all and they rely on the fact that people don't have other option for commute. The trains are constantly late specially on peak time, which is the most expensive!!! The tickets are so expensive for the service that they provide. Not reliable at all, I am sorry that there are no alternatives, otherwise wouldn't use then at all!! Expensive and poor service...

items.title: It's overcrowded
items.review_text:
It's overcrowded.  I saw quite a lot of people needing to stand up for almost 2 hours from Birmingham Moor Street down to London Marylebone.

Please try to provide more trains during the holidays.  You ruin the railway service in the UK!

items.title: Customer service, what customer service?
items.review_text: All I wanted to do was to claim compensation for a cancelled train journey. First the online compensation form was extremely hard to navigate and would not allow me to enter all the details. I then spent a very frustrating hour going round in countless circles on their website just to find an email address so that I could notify them. In the end I found it hidden away in an obscure corner of a customer complaints document. How appropriate! For customer service read customer avoidance!

items.title: Used to be fantastic -now one of the…
items.review_text: Used to be fantastic -now one of the worst. Late, old and short formed trains. Delays cancellations and endless excuses and yet the prices still keep going up. Avoid like the plague if you can. You will be standing for all of your journey no matter the time of day.

items.title: CH1R21 on 28th December 2023 68010 set AL01
items.review_text:
Price all right considering it was last minute as a result of disruption with a different company 

10.02 on the 28th out of Marylebone . Ran with 68010 set AL01 . Great seats . Announcements explaining that towards the front , the toilet is broken . On some other trains that would actually be a problem but these are walk through so for most , simple , just walk through. I looked at the accessible one near the end of the journey (think we'd just left Dorridge , around 100 miles from London) . Was clean and everything .

Note that boarding in Leamington Spa / Warwick was absolute chaos . I think extra dwell time at Leamington Spa is needed , even if this means some calls have to be removed  on this departure . 

I also found all staff to be polite and friendly

EDIT: This ride ended up being free because another train company cancelled onward trains .(isn't Chiltern's fault!)

items.title: Abuse of paying customers.
items.review_text: Chiltern railways fraud officer aggressively stopped me even though i had tapped out and harrassed me for details alluding he has the right, even though i pay maximium fare everytime I travel. He seemed accustomed to bullying paying customers. poor form. terrible impression.

items.title: Disgusted!!
items.review_text:
Disgusted!!
Knowing full well that many people would be travelling to Warwick this morning for the Commonwealth Games, Chiltern Rail kindly CANCEL the only train that would get people there in time for the start!!!!

items.title: Only 4 carriage train on the main…
items.review_text: Only 4 carriage train on the main Birmingham to London train. Had to stand the whole way from Warwick parkway to London marylebone.  We were crammed in like sardines. An absolute disgrace. This used to be such a good line. Now it's a disgrace.

items.title: Totally useless
items.review_text:
Totally useless - Cancel trains with no explanation - help line is a complete joke - No staff.

No point saying much more as they obviously don't give a toss what their customers think as they just don't bother to respond to any feedback as you can see from the reviews on Trustpilot

items.title: Slow Chiltern Rail services.
items.review_text:
Why are Chiltern Rail services from Oxford Parkway to Marylebone now taking 80 minutes - no convenient fast services? Unheated carriages.
Guess I’ll go back to using GWR to Paddington- at least they care about passengers and have regular 52 minute services direct to London

items.title: Service was really good pre pandemic.
items.review_text: Service was really good pre pandemic.. But where do you start with CR.. I honestly try and avoid using the train if I can. Rarely on time, shorter trains and a complete lack of info when things go wrong. If you are unfortunate to have to use the  Aylesbury to Marylebone line (via Amersham) it’s a constant blame game between CR, TFL and Network Rail.. So many signal failures, points issues in between strike action. Not sure if this is a new policy but if have purchased a ticket from a station office/machine you now have to waste your time claiming a refund directly from the station you purchased from. All well and good but most of the time I travel at weekends so no staff from CR are on duty… Basically if you have to use CR, always buy on a credit card so you can easily do a chargeback via your bank rather bother with 4 forms and countless emails.

items.title: One sided change of journey conditions
items.review_text: One sided change of journey conditions. Just purchase a ticket from London to Bicester, which is fine and all, as it shown a journey of 1 hour at the purchase (and google). When I received the confirmation, I see that the journey has been changed to almost 7 hours. I technically get to my destination faster, if I sit on my bicycle. This is outrageous.

items.title: As a whole Chiltern railways disappoint…
items.review_text:
As a whole Chiltern railways disappoint me time and time again. But after tonight when my purse was stolen and I provided proof I purchased a ticket and almost missed the last train because of their complete incompetence. Then when annoyed with the manager at Marylebone I was told to mind myself! Money grabbers, poor customer service.
I was even told "well you NEED to buy a ticket to travel... i said I did, someone stole it, and I have email confirmation, the guard shrugged at me. I was travelling with my child!

items.title: Hopeless bunch
items.review_text:
Hopeless bunch. You buy the ticket and their stupid app won't release it to me, yep that's right - MY PROPERTY, THAT I'VE PAID FOR - until the day of use. So v early in the morning that just gives me another thing to worry about.

Dismal customer service. If we had a decent rail regulator this would be fixed.

items.title: Shameful
items.review_text:
Shameful
They cram people like cattle into the coaches, have you stand for 2 hours all the way from Marylebone to Birmingham. No chance to even sit on the floor as people are standing back to back you can't even get on your knees. Insane heat and polluted air, everyone sweating and some getting sick. And it's like this literally every single time I have to take this 'service'. They don't give a .. about you, four carriages always no matter how busy the train is but they take your money £36 for one way. In every normal country with functional institutions these people would have been sacked long time ago.

items.title: Why would you have only two carriages…
items.review_text: Why would you have only two carriages to London in half term at 11.30 in the morning with signs saying keep a safe distance , if we could . Two hours standing standing next to an unmasked stranger . Unbelievable !!!! Incompetent management !! Corporate irresponsibility !!

items.title: WORST TRAIN SERVICE OF THEM ALL! Appalling service !!
items.review_text:
Appalling service !!
Travelled with this terrible service over the bank holiday on a Sunday (9/4/2023)
Horrendous journey, from Oxford to London, multitude of stops and  ZERO SEATS ! 
Traveling with family, child with learning difficulties whom broken down due to the capacity on the train and well over any any safety standards . The train guard calling that all passengers squeeze in and use all space! There was no space!. Not only unsafe but, unhealthy too. 
Made a complaint to this rubbish service and someone called Toni Mee ( customer service) has attempted to ‘fob’ me off with a pre- txt spiel of rubbish defending there own poor service. 
I don’t see how paying the ridiculous price of train tickets and not been able to seat down is either value for money or acceptable either. 
Worst service ever ! 
Avoid this service if possible and organisation as they certainly don’t have paying customers best interest at heart. 
AVOID! 
Worst journey and worst train service EVER!

items.title: Aylesbury station coustumer services.
items.review_text:
On Sunday I bought a ticket for London Marylebone. Unfortunately all the train has been canceled and I try to get the claim over the branch but was already left. So I went on Monday to get the claim for my ticket and the lady from there she was so bored to solve my ticket and she advice me to do it online. My question is why they still keep the branch open when they don't help you for anything? 
Could someone explain the situation?

items.title: COVID safety measures????
items.review_text: The train was packed within 2 stations of leaving Aylesbury, old people (and young kids) forced to stand up / crammed in all the way to London. COVID safety measures? What a joke!. I wouldn’t be surprised if those taken pics send them to the Papers, a dreadful / disgusting service.

items.title: This train company is untrustworthy
items.review_text: This train company is untrustworthy. I bought an online train ticket and the collection code didn't work. I had to jump through many hoops in order to get my refund and I was forced to buy a new ticket on the train for my journey. There are other stress free websites that you can book tickets through. Very disappointed about their customer service as I've never had a problem with them over  the last 4-5 years.

items.title: Why is there only ever 2 carriages?!
items.review_text:
I wish I could give Chiltern Railways a zero.

I use this train line (unfortunately) for everything; commuting, social, health appointments etc. I’m heavily pregnant and simply have not been able to get on any trains because they’re always reduced to 2 carriages and always hideously full. I am not in a position where I can squeeze into a heaving train and stand with my face pressed against the door! I would honestly faint. I’ve missed birthday parties, evenings at the theatre, Hospital appointments - all because when the train arrives there’s no way I can get on it. I often wait for 2 or 3 trains and in the end just admit defeat and go home. I used to go into the office 3-4 days per week, and now at best it’s 1 and I have to try and go at an unusual time of day to miss the chaos.

I’ve emailed an insane amount of times about this issue and it falls on deaf ears every time. Chiltern Railways should without a doubt be nationalised. It simply cannot be managed any worse!

items.title: Assaulted by a member of their staff
items.review_text: Assaulted by a member of their staff, who was then allowed back to his position to try it again with me, this time with my little daughter. Vile staff for the most part. They are the worst rail company by far in this country. Avoid at ALL costs.

items.title: We booked Chilton Railways to take us…London to Bham
items.review_text:
We booked Chilton Railways to take us to London as a family of three, two adults and a 9 year old child.  I was taking part in the London Marathon.  When returning back to Birmingham at 6pm we noticed only 4 carriages had been laid on this service.  Aston Villa had been playing in London that same day.  Me my family and friends were pushed barged into the train and had to remain standing up in the aisle for 2 1/2 hours great when you’ve just ran over 26 miles.
We endured drunken loud abusive and vulgar football chants with the c word shouted around the carriageway.  
Chilton Railways reply I should have called BTP and although I pay for a ticket it doesn’t guaranteed me a seat.  Chilton Railways are definitely putting profits over  the health and safety of their customers.  I wouldn’t give them 1 star.

items.title: Not enough staff to manage lost property
items.review_text:
My daughter left her case with important A level school work.
It is IMPOSSIBLE to speak to anyone re lost property- you have to send an email. A week later she had heard nothing. Due to my visit to the station, not taking no for an answer and begging, and the very kind staff, the bag was retrieved. However Chiltern had not emailed to say it was found and the system is you have to wait and wait. Apparently they are too short staffed to manage all the bags left - this is unacceptable. Heathrow takes 2 days.

items.title: A Typical Arriva U.K. Trains Setup
items.review_text: It’s been a few years since I travelled with CR and it seems that the Arriva effect has really worked its magic. You can polish a you-know-what but it’s still a you-know-what. An incredibly bumpy, uncomfortable journey in an old but refurbished Class 168 from Marylebone to Brum last night, it could almost make you queasy. To be fair, we were on time but it was a short-formed train and hadn’t been cleaned before commencing its journey. A real deterioration from its former glory days.

items.title: Worst commuter service into London
items.review_text:
Worst commuter service into London. Get a job in London, buy a house on the Chiltern Aylesbury via Amersham line, and you’ll see what I mean. No more needs to be said, go see for yourself. It’s beyond a joke.
Fancy going into London for the weekend? No chance haha unless you’re very lucky trains are running.

items.title: Recently very poor service
items.review_text: I don't know what's happened with this previously excellent rail company, but suddenly many trains are so packed it's impossible to board - people crushing in the aisles and in the door areas. I've had to stand on several occasions recently (outside rush-hour) and this is not something I expect considering the cost of rail tickets.

items.title: I assisted my disabled partner in…
items.review_text: I assisted my disabled partner in travelling today and I was abused by a member of staff threatening to fine me and or call the police cause I was on the platform without a ticket even though I informed them of my other halfs needs . This was all I in front of my 9 year old son who also has learning difficulties and caused him distress.  And also caused me distress. Anxiety and embarrassment I will be doing my best not to travel with this company anymore through there lack of understanding of the disability discrimination act.

items.title: Awful commuter service
items.review_text:
If you're travelling to / from Oxford or Birmingham, it seems that the service is OK, with frequent special offers on tickets because there is competition from other operators on these routes. 

However if you're travelling on commuter routes, every day is a litany of poor timetabling, broken down trains, high prices, short services and significant overcrowding. 

The trains don't have the services advertised on Chiltern's website (e.g. they advertise plenty of plugs, but that's only for a minority of train types) and it's clear that there will be no new investment in rolling stock until after 2021 when the franchise expires so things will only continue to go downhill.

items.title: How the mighty have fallen
items.review_text:
This company have lost their customer focus and simply trot out the same excuses (ageing stock needing more maintenance, Oxford service busier than usual) without seemingly realising that these are issues they control.  A new timetable this week was a chance to improve things but, so far, on the 7.06 train from Gerrards Cross I haven't got near to getting seat (but this is only 4 carriages whilst the 7.08 it replaced was meant to be 7 carriages although usually ran short).

They used to be so good and have the benefit of being the only company running in and out of Marylebone yet the service is appalling and the pricing is was too high.

It costs me £40 per day from Gerrards Cross including £9.30 to park and £30.30 for a travel card. The same trip on the Metropolitan line from Chalfont & Latimer is around £20 (£6 to park and £14'ish on the time... it is 15 minutes slower but I, like so many, we be going to the Met line and not returning I fear.

items.title: Consistent
items.review_text:
I see, regardless of a pandemic or normal business, we can count on Chiltern Line to be consistent.

First time on a train in months, and, ah, it is late, true to form, inching forward minute by minute.

items.title: The Worst  railway after the TFL.
items.review_text:
The Worst  railway after the TFL.

I have moved to Northolt Park about 9 months ago and because of this train line I was late more then 30 times, besides the fact that when they cancel and move the times of the trains as they please on more then half of that time was due to the fact they moved the train hours up by 10 min which counts when you live 10 min away from the station always modifying arrived and departure hours 20 min before on their website or worse the train leave 2 min before, which again make me lose it . It drives me crazy will move from the area just because I hate riding with them. Wifi does not work, and mostly they are trains with 2 carriages. Whould not recommend this line to terrorist let along working people.  


The prices does not reflect the services provided.

items.title: Awful experience
items.review_text:
Awful experience! Caught the 16.18 service from Marylebone to Oxford yesterday 19 December. Just after leaving Marylebone, the driver announced that one carriage had smoke in it, but not to worry it was probably just from the engine, due to poor maintenance and that he’d stop unscheduled at Wembley to check. He stopped, checked, we heard no more.
Then the lights went out in the front carriage. It was pitch black outside. I alerted the driver through the door into his cabin. He stopped unscheduled again, checked, and continued. The lights went on briefly. The driver announced that the lights and air conditioning in the front carriage would probably go off again, and that he had no headlights! The lights went off. It was pitch black.
We arrived at Oxford over 20 minutes late. Shocking customer service from Chiltern Railways! It has really declined since Arriva took it over - lots of cancellations, terrible overcrowding, and now serious maintenance and customer safety issues!

items.title: Three Cheers For The Banbury Office Staff
items.review_text: When my train got cancelled and I had to rearrange my journey from Banbury to London last week, I was not expecting such a helpful and targeted reply from one of the Banbury administration staff. It is so unusual these days not to receive an automated / generic reply - so I was very pleasantly surprised (and grateful) to find that this was not the case. Toni Mee gave me excellent advice and arranged for a refund that went very smoothly. Credit where credit is due to the Banbury office staff.

items.title: Unbearable experience
items.review_text:
As a regular commuter between Warwick Parkway and London Marylebone, I have seen a sudden decline in service, both in delays and in number of overcrowded journeys particularly coming out of London from 4pm onwards.  And with a health and safety hazard of sudden stops and speeding whilst those standing are treading over each other in the gangways and doorways it is a disgrace
To charge £113.50 for this level of service should not be acceptable.  Please get your trains fixed - and fix the air conditioning!  Isn’t it obvious that overcrowding on trains will increase the temperature with people breathing/ coughing over each other.  Horrible experience and someone should be held to account to raise the standard of this terrible service.

items.title: Stupidly overpriced
items.review_text:
Well, if anyone needs to take the blame for harming the environment it's this train service. Costs me £34.50 for a return ticket from Aylesbury to London. Add the costs of tube after that and it will cost close to £40 per day to commute to work. So I drive my diesel car for 32 miles to an outer London borough, pay whole day parking, and take the northwestern and tube to work. Costs me £19.60 for the whole trip at an extra 15 min both ways 

I am not the root cause of carbon overspend. It's this stupidly overpriced train service called Chilterns.

items.title: Oh dear, poor experience again
items.review_text: Oh dear, poor experience again. I visited Wembley on 23/04/23 which happened to be the same day as a Football Cup SemiFinal and also the London Marathon. Getting there in the morning, the train was reasonably full but seating was available. Coming back was a totally different story. The six o'clock service from Marylebone to Birmingham service was already jam packed at Marylebone with passengers from the London Marathon. Passengers getting on at subsequent stations were treated like sardines as the aisles were already full to capacity. The next train would have been full with football supporters and also the rest of the London Marathon attendees, I shudder to think how the service would have coped with that! I got off at Banbury and the train was still overcrowded with more people people adding to the crush. I suspect that most passengers were going to continue their journey by changing trains at Birmingham. I understand that it is difficult to gauge capacity however common sense should have prevailed and either extra trains or carriages should have been provisioned. Must try harder....

items.title: Chiltern railway failed to compensate for cancelled journey against a ticket sold 15 mins prior to journey time
items.review_text:
Chiltern railway failed to compensate me for a cancelled journey due to maintenance works when I had been sold a ticket just 15 mins prior to journey time! I appreciate that there is maintenance work on tracks some times due to which train service is interrupted. However, on those occasions, they shouldn’t be selling tickets for a journey that will never take off!

They are really expecting customers to pick up costs for untraveled journeys?!! Moreover, I had to make an extra journey to submit this claim with original tickets and that also cost me and Chiltern railways still can’t apologise and refund the costs of my original ticket!
It’s unbelievable how badly they have treated. Am very upset with the way my case has been handled!

items.title: Misleading information
items.review_text:
I don’t normally write reviews online but I’ve seen several reviews about staff being rude or racist and I think there is a high likelihood that we had met the same person.

Their staff did not let me finish my words and was not apologetic about the allegations they made earlier when in the end they found that I actually had the valid ticket. I emailed them and apparently they showed no willingness to improve how they communicate with customers. The staff scanned my ticket and told me to get a refund, saying “see? I helped you.” While the fact is you cannot get a refund if it has been scanned. I emailed them to make a suggestion that their staff might need to know this so that they won’t mislead other passengers. But they don’t think this suggestion is necessary…bc they simply said “he did not guarantee you can get a refund”. They don’t care about customers at all.

items.title: A Company putting customers  last !
items.review_text:
You cannot buy a car park ticket when you purchase your rail tickets at Banbury Station ticket office.
You are directed to a machine however it is NOT POSSIBLE TO BUY A TICKET FOR TWO DAYS  IN ADVANCE OR  FURTHER AHEAD
if you are in a rush for your train, you will miss it trying to buy a parking ticket on the day.
SOME PROGRESS
There is a very good chance of not getting a seat from Banbury on a fast train, so as somebody who has to sit down, I have the hassle of asking somebody who should not be sitting in a seat for older and disabled people to move, usually with much bad will.
This Company is TOO MEAN to hire more coaches to make trains longer.
Also at the London terminus, the Birmingham trains come in a far platform and also leave on those. The platform number being announced at the last minute.

items.title: Absolutely terrible
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible - this used to be the gold standard for privatisation. Now trains are late, short formed, over crowded to the extent you can’t get on. It has turned into the misery line. The service has been a total disgrace recently. I try to avoid it at all costs but there are no other options for me.

items.title: Consistently the best operator in the UK
items.review_text:
I've used the Mainline between London and the Midlands for twenty years, and while there have been some hiccups, the trains are comfortable and usually on time - also well priced. Though it would be nice if they re-introduced the buffet on Silver services. 

Compared to other UK operators, and I've used them all, Chiltern is great!

items.title: Thank you Chiltern Railways
items.review_text: Thank you Chiltern Railways. After Cross Country were delayed, causing me to miss my connection at Banbury, and leaving me at Leamington Spa. Rather than have me and two other passengers stuck there for two hours, Chiltern  arranged and paid for a taxi to get us to Stratford on time. The Chiltern team at Leamington we’re fabulous - took ownership for an issue they hadn’t created, and solved it. Also very warm and friendly, so thank you.

items.title: The new Chiltern timetable is…
items.review_text: The new Chiltern timetable is better,but why have the carriages been reduced,which means. Passengers being packed in like sardines  and having to stand up most of the way.Hope Adrian Shooter isn't looking down.

items.title: Great journey today on chiltern railways .
items.review_text: I can’t relate to most of these reviews. I travelled up yesterday on the horribly cramped and uncomfortable avanti service with faulty air con Euston to Birmingham new street and the overcrowded new st platforms. Contrast today came back from Birmingham moor st to london Marylebone with chiltern railways . Comfortable refurbished air conditioned carriages, beautiful relaxed airy stations, friendly staff and yes we were just a few minutes late into London but worth it to avoid new street and the awful avanti trains. 5*s :-)

items.title: Simply appalling WiFi
items.review_text: Simply appalling WiFi. I have this with no other train operator and yes, I applied all the 'fixes' suggested by the Icomera website. Unacceptable.

items.title: Packed like sardines as always
items.review_text: Yet another commute packed like sardines all the way from the Chiltern hills to London. Why does Chiltern Railways insist on providing such short trains?

items.title: What a shambles
items.review_text: What a shambles. Insufficient rolling stock on most journeys. Very expensive service and very rarely get a seat except at off peak times. Avoid at all costs

items.title: yes its cheap but its pants
items.review_text:
The trains are short distance commuter trains not suitable to run to London. seats are uncomfortable. journey time is stupid slow and the trains don't have a coffee/tea snack carriage. 

anyway my train is 10 mins delayed on what was an 1hr 45min journey if it was on time.  There are not enough carriages so lots of people have been stood.  Its just rubbish

items.title: Reasonable local train company
items.review_text: Reasonable local train company. Generally OK trains, though quite a few are old without usb chargers. Prices ok with Railcard, but extortionate otherwise. Service generally reliable but some trains too busy. App not bad.

items.title: I lost my key yesterday on the train
items.review_text: I lost my key yesterday on the train, and luckily I spoke to Billia. In gerrards cross.  Station. He’s on security and his fantastic called up Chilton railways in Marylebone and found my key within five minutes. He was so efficient, polite and always has a smile on his face. I’ll give him 10 out of 10 for helping me. Richard

items.title: We were sold time tickets, but received open. Turns out we were mis-sold; they don't really offer timed tickets
items.review_text:
We purchased tickets for a train at a specific time so that we can catch an onward journey from St Pancras. Or so we thought! The booking confirmation specifies the time of travel that we chose, but when the tickets were delivered, it turned out they have no time stamp which means we may not be able to travel at the time we need. This is basically an off-peak ticket which means you can travel at any time off-peak. Basically, we were sold one thing (as per the booking confirmation) and then delivered an entirely different thing which is not suitable. We were mis-sold. 

This is RUBBISH. DO I need to allow for a day to get to my destination for 1 h journey? Are we back in the dark ages of (rail) travel? It seems we are! 

The conclusion? If you need to be somewhere at a given time, then do yourself a favour and do NOT choose Chiltern Railways.

items.title: Best railway Company so far
items.review_text:
I wrote badly about one railway Company yesterday; today I am very pleased to comment positively on Chiltern Railway. It took me few minutes to get in touch with their Customer Service (yes, a real person!!) and the Lady explained the procedure to me. I then followed the instructions, it took barely 5 mins, and within 24 hours my problem was solved.
Thank you Chiltern, there is still hope for transport services!!

items.title: Not a great company.
items.review_text:
I regularly use these trains and there not great. The trains are overpriced for the service you get.  The trains are always dirty and packed. 

In peak times of the day they should be bringing out bigger trains or if not more trains to reduce the overcrowding. 

Also the recent strike action commencing the 5th November 22 was cancelled. I understand on the Saturday-Monday it might of been hard to bring services back to normal. On Tuesday the 8th the services should of been working normally, however trains didn’t start till after 9am, whereas the majority of other train companies ran a normal service.

items.title: Awful train company.. the absolute worst.
items.review_text:
Awful train company... so so bad.

I pay nearly £5000 a year (£407 a month) to have delays delays delays, and endless short formation coaches due to "engineering" or "broken down rolling stock"

Prices go up about £120 every year... service and what you expect as a customer goes down down down...

Commuters are having their pants pulled down by these crooks... and there's little to nothign that can be done as they simply have to get to work... on these crappy trains.

Chiltern obviously spend their yearly increasing pirates booty  on their investors and not their trains and improvements.

Staff are rude and never know what is going on.

Terrible. 

Honestly, just walk backwards or on your hand through glass... it will be quicker and less painful.... and cheaper!!

items.title: Staff are useless and the least…
items.review_text: Staff are useless and the least friendly. Delayed train to London Marylebone was supposed to arrive at 12:44 arrived at 12:35 and waited less than a minutes. People were still coming down the stair to catch it but the driver decided to shot the door in their faces and leave. Went to complaint to staff in the station, but all they would say is next train is at 13:09. Not even an apology for the wrong timing on the board. Appalling customer care.

items.title: They charged me twice
items.review_text: They charged me twice, although they delayed and canceled the train journey that I bought to use. Never ever use the Chiltern Railways again. Horrible and rude inner-train service. I contacted them for a refund, but they told me that I had to use the train that was canceled by the company...

items.title: I travelled from Aylesbury to Marylebone
items.review_text: I travelled from Aylesbury to Marylebone and there was 4 trains delayed. I then got on the train the train stinks , dusty unkept it is the worse train service and we pay for this.  I then tried to make a complaint on the website,  they have made it so difficult to make the complaint.  This is the reason why I am writing this review.  Chiltern do not have good customer service they would CLEAN the train it stinks.  Due to delays I arrived late no apologies.  I wish I could add a picture of the state of train.  We are people not animals

items.title: A very helpful young man.
items.review_text:
I have just obtained a rail card for myself and my wife, we are both pensioners and find todays high teck world difficult to navigate. 
We needn't have worried as the ticket clerk at solihull station was very helpful and kind and patient.He guided us through what we had to do making it very simple for us. Thank you very much Cash, you are a credit to Chilton railways. 12/08/21.

items.title: Lack of consistency and no proper system!
items.review_text:
Awful! So inconsistent when you call them. Each person gives you a different rule. (And only called as their online booking system kept crashing!) So if you want to exchange a ticket time - you have to book the revised times - then yourself e-mail an address asking for a refund for the other. And they still charge you £10! Basically, you do all the work - but still pay them £10 for admin!! 

First person I spoke to said I can exchange over the phone, the second said I couldn't! The first person sent me the tickets in the post, the second said she couldn't! And that for my refund I have to physically go the relevant station (25 mins from my home) - collect the tickets then send a specific e-mail for a refund!! Talk about sending the customer on a wild goose chase! Nightmare!   

Still awaiting for confirmation e-mails to come through! And of course - a refund!!

items.title: Taking money but not delivering tickets!
items.review_text: On attempt to buy tickets online, I had a message that payment can’t be done, only for money to be taken off my account, but tickets not delivered!Plain fraud!

items.title: Chiltern Railways Decline
items.review_text: I've travelled with Chiltern Railways into London for work for many years.  It used to be a really good service, particularly compared to Worst Great Western, which I was previously using.  However, over the past years, I think since it was taken over by Arriva, it's slowly deteriorated - short trains, late trains, over-crowded trains, trains which aren't called until the last minute at Marylebone and Oxford so a whole trainload of passengers trying to get on at the same time.  So in the past week or so - a massive delay on a Friday with a broken down train at High Wycombe, a long delay on Weds last, last night (2nd Dec) the 18,18 nearly  half an hour late - this morning the 07.25 from Oxford Parkway only four carriages due to a train fault - so rammed.  All for the princely sum of nearly £6k a year???!

items.title: Birmingham Moor Street to Marylebone.
items.review_text:
Travelled from Birmingham Moor Street to Marylebone. On time departure/arrival sounds good. Journey took under two hours with minimum stops.
Train was clean and tidy. Fare is also reasonable.

items.title: Don't sign up for text alerts
items.review_text: Don't sign up for text alerts! I booked one return to London over a month ago. Now on its weekly anniversary I receive a text message about my 'upcoming journey'. It says I have to text to 60033 to stop the messages. Probably a premium rate number. What nonsense!

items.title: Shittt service
items.review_text: Every weekend i have to pay a cab (18 pounds) because at 7 am there is no one train able ? Unbelievable, is literally a  shitttt service

items.title: Not great…
items.review_text: Trains always delayed or even cancelled when it says it will be on time. Expensive season tickets, but the WiFi never works. Monopoly powers at its best.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service. Marylebone Platform announcement at the last minute then everyone dashes for the train. This is no way to run a railway. Incompetent at best.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: I have to agree with the majority of other comments. Yesterday (10th May) I caught the 07.30 Aylesbury to Marylebone train. Despite the automated station announcement and electronic displays stating that it would have four carriages there were in fact two. On departure from Stoke Mandeville every seat was taken and from Great Missenden there was barely any standing room. The platform at Amersham was crowded (the train was scheduled to run non stop to Marylebone so obviously a popular service for commuters) but it was impossible for anyone to get on the train due to the crush. The driver was very apologetic and said there was a shortage of stock due to an earlier breakdown. To be honest, even four carriages would have been nowhere near enough. Most trains on Chiltern Railways are far too short and the Class 165 units are horribly cramped with their ridiculous 2+3 seating and virtually no legroom. Also the Aylesbury to London service is no faster than it was 60 years ago and is being slowed still further with the new timetable! Another problem is at Marylebone, where platform numbers are not announced until a few minutes before departure, followed by the inevitable mad rush to the train, which is usually at the far end of the platform. All this for the extortionate fares being charged....almost £20 for a single journey of 38 miles. Not good enough.

items.title: The staff are not helpful  at all
items.review_text: The staff are not helpful at all . And 2 of the staff seems to be rude and racist as well . Not happy at all with the customer service, I made formal complaint with the manager , he seem to be helpful but still very unpleasant service overall !!! They are not helpful at all.

items.title: Poor experience with Parking company means return to car for journeys
items.review_text:
Have no problems with the trains, but unfortunately their choice of parking contractors in APCOA have soured the experience. 

I now refuse to use APCOA car parks, which ultimately means I can no longer use Chiltern railways for my journey, now reverting to my car. Shame for Chiltern as that’s £5k pa lost revenue for them, due to poor choice of parking contractor.

items.title: Always late I can count on one hand how…
items.review_text: Always late I can count on one hand how many times the train has arrived on time .. often busy and sometimes no seats the train  seats on the train I catch in the morning from birmingham are annoying as you can't move the arms so you have to literally squeeze in to the seat... I don't no why they can't make the arms movable ..

items.title: Fantastic Customer Service
items.review_text: James from Customer Service was exceptionally helpful and friendly. He went above and beyond to provide me with information that was useful for my journey. Also, it took less than 5 mins for my call to be answered!

items.title: Terrible decline in service
items.review_text:
As regular commuter from Haddenham & Thame Parkway over the last 20 years, I can honestly say that the service on this line has deteriorated to such an extent that I’m genuinely considering moving house to be able to commute from somewhere better. 

The reliability and punctuality has historically been brilliant but in the 2 years since the end of lockdown, it has been a total disaster. All trains are shorter than they used to be. It is almost impossible to get a seat on any of the principal commuter services. On many occasions, the overcrowding is simply dangerous and it’s difficult to believe they are actually allowed to do this. The service has been particularly hit by industrial action in the last 6 months. The upper deck of the car park has been closed off for several years awaiting demolition because it’s unsafe - yet everyone is still expected to park underneath this apparently unsafe structure. Trains are dirty and seating etc hasn’t been upgraded in at least 10 years. 

If you are looking to move to the area and the commuter line is a big part of your thinking, think again.

items.title: New timetable is a shambles
items.review_text:
New timetable is a shambles. Late trains and no seats. 
We, the travelling public, deserve better given the extortionate fares we pay

items.title: Truly shocking customer service
items.review_text: Truly shocking customer service.  If you have the option of making your journey by any other means, take it.  I'd rather walk than catch their trains again.

items.title: I live on the other side of London now.
items.review_text:
I have been commuting on Chiltern Railways for the past 3 weeks, what an incredible experience. The seats are comfortable, the trains are clean and don't smell. There is a quiet area on the carriage and a toilet that is actually not locked all of the time. 
The seating areas have leg space, cup holders, desks, or fold down trays, there is even free WiFi. The absolute shocker is that the trains have always been on time, I've even been getting to my destinations (Marylebone & Gerrards Cross) early!

I was previously subjected to the horrors of having to rely on Southeastern Rail for the commute, that's if they decided on any given day to have an attempt at running a "train service".

Well done Chiltern, I wasn't aware that commuter trains could actually be a pleasant experience.

items.title: A poor service, no improvement..
items.review_text: Late running trains in/out of Marylebone for the past couple of weeks (I assume the weather is to blame?), coupled with the fact that they’re normally short of carriages makes for a rubbish end to the working day. I’ve seen no improvement in this sub-standard service.

items.title: No doubt this review will be ignored by Chiltern Railways
items.review_text: This review will no doubt fall on deaf ears over at Chiltern Railways HQ but the service from Oxford Parkway to Marylebone is bloody awful. Yes, the line is busier while the bridge at Didcot Parkway is being repaired and everyone from the Oxford via Reading to Paddington service uses the Marylebone line. But why oh why does Chiltern Railways like to 'play' with us passengers by constantly putting on two or four carriages for busy journeys? Am on the 2307 train from London Marylebone and people are sitting on the floor because some geniuses put on two carriages for the last train of the evening. We've missed events because of this maddening two carriages policy and ensuing safety issues on the journey. One journey was delayed by 50mins, less than the 60mins+ delay required for a full refund. We were offered a £5 refund, after paying £40+ for tickets. Nothing of course for £90 in tickets to a play we were travelling to see that we were not allowed in for because our train was delayed by 50mins so we arrived at the door too late. Every journey now involves people sitting on the floor, standing or feeling faint due to overcrowding. There's got to be a better way. Please for the love of God can you stop putting on just two carriages during busy times. And stop saying 'thank you for travelling with Chiltern Railways...'. We don't have a bloody choice do we? I would suggest nationalising the service but am unsure if the government can be trusted to do any better...

items.title: Big up Phill in Princes Risborough
items.review_text: Wanted to say a huge thank you to Phill the station manager at Princes Risborough Station who helped me get my bag back that I left on the train. Also thank you to the train driver who I’m afraid I didn’t get their name. The bag was back with me in an hour incredible service and Phill acted fast and was a life saver.

items.title: Service with a smile.
items.review_text: I couldn’t have had better service this afternoon  when I bought advance tickets for travelling from Aylesbury to Marylebone. I was given excellent advice and told how to get the cheapest option. Thank you to the very friendly and helpful man behind the desk.

items.title: Very poor track
items.review_text: Very poor track. The line between Marylebone and Birmingham Moor Street must be the most poorly constructed track in the UK. As I write this, the train feels like its bouncing along the line with severe side-side movement. No wonder the train runs slowly.

items.title: The app is rubbish
items.review_text: The app is rubbish. Trying to buy a ticket.  Wouldn’t register my payment card.  Worked fine on Trainline.   And they are closing booking offices!

items.title: Avoid if you have a choice.
items.review_text:
Travel both for work and leisure into London. Ageing and frequently short formed and poorly maintained trains that have damaged seats or interior panels hanging off (to a level it damages your clothing or air conditioning fails and pours water on you), insufficient cleaning, poor communication during delays, detached management and customer services, and high fares that cannot possibly be justified given all of the above.

Was once abandoned for two hours on a platform during winter after they cancelled our service part way. Provided no available ongoing transport other than to pay for own taxi and no communication on how to get home.

Chiltern just seem to be running the clock until the end of the franchise. Avoid if you can.

Update on damaged clothing (13/12/19): 

Chiltern will only deal with the claim if I post them my only coat in the dead of Winter and they refuse any flexibility on this (such as my offer to bring the coat into a station for inspection of the damage). No apology offered, and a complete lack of empathy from customer service.

items.title: Would like to thank the lady on the…
items.review_text:
Would like to thank the lady on the barrier (blonde hair, glasses - I did not get her name) at Marylebone station who helped me to get a connection to Reading via Oxford. It was about 23:00 on 27/12/19 and all trains from Paddington had been cancelled due to engineering works, I was in stress mode and running out of time, facing the prospect of being stranded in London for the night.
Thanks to her help and speedy assistance with obtaining the correct ticket and platform number I was just able to get the last possible train to Oxford that could connect with a train to Reading.
That's what I call service !

items.title: There is one day without issue plus we…
items.review_text: There is one day without issue plus we pay a monthly of 530,00 pound which no very affordable and when t he train is on time we are litterally squished like sardines in a jar…..shame

items.title: My railcard expired on the 6th…
items.review_text: My railcard expired on the 6th September. I am a young person travelling on my own. I made an honest mistake by booking a £3.45 ticket using my railcard (16-24 railcard) and not realising that my railcard expired 6 days ago. As I got off at the station there were a line of ticket inspectors waiting and asking for my ticket, I nicely pulled up my ticket and the man asked to see my railcard, I pulled out my railcard and didn’t realise it said it had expired, he asked me when it expired and it was only 6 days ago, I offered to pay the full fare (which was £5) and he said he was going to charge me instead, it was very humiliating and completely unreasonable for such an honest mistake that a loyal customer has made. I’m shocked at how they bullied me into paying their ridiculous fee. Perhaps this isn’t so much to do with railcard but just the unhelpful chiltern railways staff who were very rude and hardly gave me any chance to talk about the money I’ve just wasted on them. I wanted to book another railcard with them but now I’m just going to drive.

items.title: Stranded
items.review_text:
Yet again let down by Chiltern Railways. I arrived at the platform 10 minutes early at Amersham station to catch a train at 1433. The train was initially delayed until 1439 and then as usual just disappeared off the phone app. At 1455 a guy stood next to me went over the footbridge to the ticket office and when he came back he said he'd been told that the train was just delayed. 
Wind forward another half an hour and still no train so after checking the app and finding that the 1533 train was also going to be delayed I went to the ticket office to ask for a partial refund on my return ticket as I was already late and going to have to get a taxi.
